intro: Herpestis javanica, commonly known as the Javan spurge, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are clustered in cyathia, a characteristic feature of the Euphorbiaceae family. Herpestis javanica is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
